metadata.title: CVE-2018-12390 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 62 and Firefox ESR 60.2. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort thatsome of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 63, Firefox ESR < 60.3, and Thunderbird < 60.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
